revised_title: Observations of Unusual Phenomena and the Nature of Cold
tldr: The author, James Gregory, and his correspondent, Sir George Makenzy, observed and documented various unusual phenomena related to cold, ice formation, and plant growth. They noticed that certain lakes never freeze, while others freeze quickly, and that the steam rising from one lake, Loch Ness, seems to keep the surrounding area warm and plants thriving. They also discussed the possibility of the water turning holly into a greenish stone and its potential uses.
